Justification: Sore throat, fever, headache, and cough are common symptoms of a viral upper respiratory infection.
Sore throat, fever, and headache are common symptoms of strep throat.  The absence of a runny nose or congestion is also suggestive of strep throat.
Sore throat, fever, headache, and body aches are common symptoms of mononucleosis.  The absence of a runny nose or congestion is also suggestive of mononucleosis.
